description: This chapter addresses dealing with sexual immorality in the church, the importance of church discipline, and the necessity of removing sin from the congregation.

questions.question: What type of sin was reported in the Corinthian church?
How serious was the sexual immorality in the Corinthian church?
options: Of a kind that even pagans do not tolerate

questions.question: What was the specific nature of this sexual immorality?
options: A man is sleeping with his father's wife
A man with another man's wife

questions.question: How did the Corinthians respond to this sin?
What should the Corinthians have done with the man who did this?
options: Have put out of your fellowship the man who has been doing this

questions.question: How was Paul present with the Corinthians?
options: Even though I am not physically present, I am with you in spirit

questions.question: What had Paul already done regarding the person who committed this sin?
options: I have already passed judgment in the name of our Lord Jesus

questions.question: With what power should they be assembled?
options: And the power of our Lord Jesus is present

questions.question: To whom should they hand over this man?
options: Hand this man over to Satan

questions.question: What was the purpose of handing this man over to Satan?
options: For the destruction of the flesh, so that his spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord

questions.question: How did Paul describe their boasting?
In Paul's analogy, what does a little yeast do?
options: Leavens the whole batch of dough

questions.question: According to Paul's instruction, what should the Corinthians get rid of?
options: Get rid of the old yeast

questions.question: Who is our Passover lamb?
What has happened to Christ, our Passover lamb?
With what should we not keep the Festival?
options: Not with the old bread leavened with malice and wickedness

questions.question: With what bread should we keep the Festival?
options: With the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth

questions.question: What had Paul previously written to the Corinthians?
options: I wrote to you in my letter not to associate with sexually immoral people

questions.question: With whom did Paul NOT mean they should avoid associating?
options: Not at all meaning the people of this world who are immoral, or the greedy and swindlers, or idolaters

questions.question: What would happen if they could not associate with immoral people of this world?
options: They would have to punish them
They would have to judge them
In that case you would have to leave this world
They would have to stay away from them

questions.question: With whom should believers not associate if they claim to be a brother or sister?
options: Anyone who claims to be a brother or sister but is sexually immoral or greedy, an idolater or slanderer, a drunkard or swindler

questions.question: What should believers not do with such people?
options: Do not even eat with such people

questions.question: Who is responsible for judging those outside the church?
options: What business is it of mine

questions.question: Who should judge those inside the church?
options: Are you not to judge those inside?

questions.question: Who will judge those outside the church?
What final instruction did Paul give to the Corinthians?
options: Expel the wicked person from among you

questions.question: How was the sexual immorality reported among the Corinthians?
How does Paul describe the Corinthians?
What is compared to unleavened bread?
In whose name should they hand over this man?
options: In the name of our Lord Jesus
